_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
December 19th, 2:10 PM
Good afternoon riders and skiers! Tomorrow is a big change in weather, tonight temps will plumet below freezing and remain around mid 20s at the base and mid-teens at the summit. We'll be greeted with partial morning sun, with clouds increasing through the day. Change in temps will affect snow conditions overnight, expect firm machine grooming and variable conditions on the mountain. With the drop in temps snowmaking will be firing back up tonight on Sleeper, Sugarbear Road, and Riemergasse, using caution as conditions vary around snow guns and visibility is low. Today we offer 135 skiable acres served by 3 lifts and 26 open trails. All natural terrain is currently closed in efforts of preservation.

Mt. Ellen is making its season debut tomorrow! GMX will begin loading at 8:00 AM, stop by and grab a breakfast sandwich with your early turns. Remember that Local Passes are now only valid at Mt. Ellen on Saturdays. The Sugarbush Parks crew has assembled a freestyle setup for opening day at Mt. Ellen with 14 features and 2 jumps. Plus, join us on Dec 20th at 3:00 PM, at Green Mountain Lodge for our Champagne Cowbell Party, celebrating Mt. Ellen's return with friends and family. Check out all of our winter events!

Operations will move to weekend hours, which means lower mountain lifts spin from 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM and upper mountain lifts spin from 9:00 AM to 3:45 PM. Reminder, terrain off upper mountain lifts is for advanced skiers and riders only. Plus, all terrain is variable so please use caution and care.

ALL uphill travel is CLOSED- we kindly ask you respect our hardworking operations team.   

Have an Ikon Base Pass? Come ski before 12/25 and earn a voucher for an unrestricted lift ticket for yourself to be used any day here for the rest of the season. Grab up to five of these tickets simply by skiing and riding here before Christmas. Don't miss out on all of our deals including 50% off December lodging through December 26th.
